response_metadata.response_text:
{
"overview": "This measure to \"satisfy several claims against the State, its officers, or its employees\" (HB990_HD2_HSCR1146_.HTM.txt) has been amended by \"Adding four additional claims that were resolved\" (HB990_HD2_HSCR1146_.HTM.txt). This amendment finalizes the inclusion of claims previously requested for addition by the Department of the Attorney General. The bill now makes appropriations for a total of twenty-one claims, encompassing miscellaneous claims, judgments, and settlements involving various state departments.",
"appropriations": "The appropriations now specify the sources for departmental funds not previously detailed in prior versions. The legislative document specifies an appropriation of $1,250,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) \"out of the state highway fund\" for the Department of Transportation, Highways Division. Additionally, the measure appropriates $90,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) \"out of the judiciary funds\" for a claim against the Judiciary.",
"assumptions_and_methodology": "",
"agency_impact": "The Department of Education supports the bill, stating it \"enables timely resolution of legal obligations, preventing unnecessary litigation and financial burdens\" (HB990_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-25-25_.PDF.txt). This allows the Department to \"focus on its core mission of educating Hawaii's students\" and \"ensures fiscal responsibility and protects essential educational resources\" (HB990_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-25-25_.PDF.txt). The Hawaii Department of Transportation also submitted testimony in support of the measure (HB990_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-25-25_.PDF.txt).",
"economic_impact": "According to testimony, the bill supports fiscal responsibility by \"preventing unnecessary litigation and financial burdens\" (HB990_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-25-25_.PDF.txt). Settling these claims allows the state to protect \"essential educational resources\" that might otherwise be spent on ongoing legal costs (HB990_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-25-25_.PDF.txt).",
"policy_impact": "The Department of the Attorney General's testimony confirms it has \"complied with section 37-77.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes (HRS), which requires the Attorney General to develop and implement a procedure for advising our client agencies on how to avoid future claims\" (HB990_HD1_TESTIMONY_FIN_02-25-25_.PDF.txt). This reflects an ongoing policy to mitigate the risk of future liabilities and associated costs to the State.",
"revenue_sources": "The appropriations are specified to be paid from three distinct funding sources. The legislative document details payments to be made \"out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii\" (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) for the majority of claims. It also specifies appropriations \"out of the state highway fund\" (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) and \"out of the judiciary funds\" (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) for claims related to those specific entities.",
"six_year_fiscal_implications": "The bill now includes appropriations for several claims not detailed in the previous fiscal note. From the general fund, new claims include $5,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) for the settlement of Paul Aker v. Hawaii Emergency Management Agency, $150,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) for Katherine Balatico v. State of Hawaii, and $400,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) for Royal Contracting Company, Ltd. v. Department of Hawaiian Home Lands. Other newly specified general fund claims are $450,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) for Jennifer Reber v. State of Hawaii, $100,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) for a tort claim by Brenda Osmer, and $32,632.85 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) for Deborah Kwan v. State of Hawaii. The measure also appropriates $1,075,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) from the state highway fund for Juan Jimmie Aldeguer v. State of Hawaii and $175,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) for Estate of Bruce Perdue v. State of Hawaii. Additionally, $90,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) is appropriated from judiciary funds for Leanne Rosa v. Randal G.B. Valenciano. All unexpended balances will lapse on June 30, 2026 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt).",
"operating_revenue_impact": "",
"capital_expenditure_impact": "",
"fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "",
"updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The primary update is that the measure has been formally amended by \"Adding four additional claims that were resolved\" (HB990_HD2_HSCR1146_.HTM.txt), finalizing the total appropriation that was previously a pending request. The updated bill text now provides specific funding sources for all claims, including appropriations of $1,250,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) \"out of the state highway fund\" and $90,000.00 (HB990_HD2_.HTM.txt) \"out of the judiciary funds,\" which were not previously detailed. This version of the bill provides a complete and final list of all claims and their legislatively approved funding sources."
}

Hayashi, Superintendent of Education Bill Title: HB 0990, HD1 MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR CLAIMS AGAINST THE STATE, ITS OFFICERS, OR ITS EMPLOYEES. Purpose of Bill: Makes appropriations and approves payments for claims against the

Bill: Makes appropriations and approves payments for claims against the State, its officers, and its employees. Effective 7/1/3000. (HD1) Department's Position: The Hawaii State Department of Education (Department) supports HB990, HD1, which appropriates funds to satisfy claims against the State. This measure enables timely resolution of legal obligations, preventing unnecessary

This measure enables timely resolution of legal obligations, preventing unnecessary litigation and financial burdens. By settling claims efficiently, this bill allows the Department to focus on its core mission of educating Hawaii's students. Appropriating these funds ensures fiscal responsibility and protects essential educational resources. Thank you for the opportunity to

protects essential educational resources. Thank you for the opportunity to provide testimony in support of this measure.
